unnormalised: Okay, here's the generated text based on the provided parameters:
normalised: As a new mother, I was quite apprehensive about my first visit to the O-B-G-Y-N after delivery. Doctor Meera at Cloudnine Hospital, Bangalore, had been recommended by my sister-in-law, but still, hospital visits always make me a bit anxious. I remember thinking, "Is everything normal? Will the stitches be okay? What if I have postpartum complications?".

unnormalised: As a new mother, I was quite apprehensive about my first visit to the Ob-Gyn after delivery. Dr. Meera at Cloudnine Hospital, Bangalore, had been recommended by my sister-in-law, but still, hospital visits always make me a bit anxious. I remember thinking, "Is everything normal? Will the stitches be okay? What if I have postpartum complications?".
normalised: The appointment was scheduled for ten thirty A-M on fifteenth july two thousand and twenty four, almost six weeks after little Rohan was born. Reaching on time was a struggle, thanks to Bangalore traffic. My husband, Suresh, managed to find parking after circling around for fifteen minutes. We finally got to the clinic and filled out the usual forms, mentioning my weight was sixty five kilogram, which was still ten kilogram more than before pregnancy.

unnormalised: The appointment was scheduled for 10:30 AM on 15/07/2024, almost six weeks after little Rohan was born. Reaching on time was a struggle, thanks to Bangalore traffic. My husband, Suresh, managed to find parking after circling around for 15 minutes. We finally got to the clinic and filled out the usual forms, mentioning my weight was 65 kg, which was still 10 kg more than before pregnancy.
normalised: Doctor Meera was very patient and understanding. She checked my vitals (B-P was one hundred and twenty slash eighty) and asked about my breastfeeding schedule. She also enquired if I was experiencing any P-P-D symptoms. I mentioned I felt low on energy but attributed it to sleepless nights with the baby. She prescribed a multivitamin (Pregnacare Max, one tab daily) and encouraged me to get some "me time."

unnormalised: Dr. Meera was very patient and understanding. She checked my vitals (BP was 120/80) and asked about my breastfeeding schedule. She also enquired if I was experiencing any PPD symptoms. I mentioned I felt low on energy but attributed it to sleepless nights with the baby. She prescribed a multivitamin (Pregnacare Max, 1 tab daily) and encouraged me to get some "me time."
normalised: The examination itself was quick and painless. She reassured me that the C-section incision was healing well and advised on some exercises to strengthen my pelvic floor muscles. We also discussed contraception options; she suggested I-U-D or oral pills. I'm not sure which one to go for yet, but at least I have some information now.

unnormalised: The examination itself was quick and painless. She reassured me that the C-section incision was healing well and advised on some exercises to strengthen my pelvic floor muscles. We also discussed contraception options; she suggested IUD or oral pills. I'm not sure which one to go for yet, but at least I have some information now.
normalised: Overall, the visit eased my worries. Knowing that Doctor Meera, with her twenty plus years of experience, was there to guide me was reassuring. It's so important to find a good O-B-G-Y-N you can trust during and after pregnancy. I would recommend her to anyone in Bangalore looking for a competent and caring doctor.

unnormalised: Overall, the visit eased my worries. Knowing that Dr. Meera, with her 20+ years of experience, was there to guide me was reassuring.
